basicInfo.html: You can use most html functions for formatting and stylying of basic widgets (but not buttons, labels, etc). You can also use inline css styling within the html and/or use the css property on the widget. There are many examples in this room. Open the JSON Editor and have a look. One limitation you will see is that you must cram all the text together and cannot use line breaks to help visually separate elements. Everything you see in the first column of text on the left is a single widget. You can use the <q style='color:teal'>${PROPERTY}</q> feature anywhere.

example5.html:
You can insert images on their own, or inline with the text. You can change their color with an inline css filter. Because the VTT icons start as black, the filter is complicated. Try experimenting with the hue-rotate value, but you will not get all colors.

You can also put images inline with text, but you will have to adjust the size manually as they will not change size if you adjust the font size
